definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Grandma mouse also shouted, …… . But Jules did not care.
sentences.chinese: 鼠奶奶也發出了陣陣驚叫聲，這一家子簡直亂了套。

sentences.english: Nothing was stolen, but now a family of birds is living somewhere in my house.
sentences.chinese: 東西倒是一樣沒少，就是有一家子鳥飛進來紮了窩。

sentences.english: 'It's difficult to raise a family on one income. '
sentences.chinese: 單靠一個人的收入很難供養一家子。

sentences.english: It will do so through yet another subsidiary, Beijing Aeon Co.
sentences.chinese: 它將通過另一家子公司，北京永旺公司來執行。

sentences.english: The family arrived at the show and was in their seats in good time.
sentences.chinese: 一家子到了演出現場，迅速地在座位上坐好。

sentences.english: This is so awful, they were such a sweet family.
sentences.chinese: 真教人難過，這麼可愛的一家子。

sentences.english: The family look like a "burning passion"?
sentences.chinese: 這一家子像不像《激情燃燒的歲月》？

sentences.english: So you took your family to the mall, and everyone was excited about a fun-filled day of shopping.
sentences.chinese: 你帶上一家子逛商場，每個人都開心的血拚了一天。

sentences.english: And I really don't think my salary is going to be able to support us.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得我現在的收入沒法供一家子人喫穿。

sentences.english: That family of eclipses in Virgo and Pisces is over and not due back for nine years.
sentences.chinese: 處女和雙魚的月食一家子玩完了，9年之內不會回來。

sentences.english: I have never seen a coati before and luckily saw a family of them in the museum.
sentences.chinese: 我從沒見過長鼻浣熊，很幸運的在博物館看到一家子。

sentences.english: What a big family:Four generations live under one roof.
sentences.chinese: 好大一家子》四世同堂的一家人。

sentences.english: She turned and, with a smile, guided her brood into the waiting room.
sentences.chinese: 她轉身帶着微笑，帶着她的一家子走進候診室。

definition: the old and the young/the youngest member of the family
sb with whom one is on familiar terms/sb from the same place (same house, same town etc)/one of us
dragged down by having a family to feed
two (colloquial equivalent of 兩個|两个)/both/some
three (colloquial equivalent of 三個|三个)
parents of one's daughter-in-law or son-in-law/relatives by marriage

Sun Tzu, also known as Sun Wu 孫武|孙武[Sun1 Wu3] (c. 500 BC, dates of birth and death uncertain), general, strategist and philosopher of the Spring and Autumn Period (700-475 BC), believed to be the author of the “Art of War” 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
